docs.snippet: Southward the course of industrial empire continues to take its way. And not all of it is at the cost of New England's mill towns.
docs.lead_paragraph: Southward the course of industrial empire continues to take its way. And not all of it is at the cost of New England's mill towns.
docs.abstract: Dun & Bradstreet wkly wholesale index down

headline.main: FINANCIAL AND BUSINESS SIDELIGHTS OF THE DAY

docs.snippet: Bernardo Wexler of Argentina defeated Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia in the sixth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Buenos Aires. It was Ivkov's first loss in the competition.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bernardo Wexler of Argentina defeated Boris Ivkov of Yugoslavia in the sixth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Buenos Aires. It was Ivkov's first loss in the competition.

headline.main: WEXLER TOPPLES IVKOV IN 39 MOVES; Wins Sixth-Round Match in Argentine Chess Event-- Szabo Takes Lead

docs.snippet: Pan-Amer tournament, Punta del Este, Uruguay: opening postponed
docs.abstract: Pan-Amer tournament, Punta del Este, Uruguay: opening postponed

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

headline.main: NAJDORF TIES PANNO FOR THIRD IN CHESS

docs.snippet: Laszlo Szabo of Hungary held a 6-1 edge after the seventh round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina yesterday. Szabo played a drawn game with Ludek Pachman of Czechoslovakia in a King's Indian defense of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Laszlo Szabo of Hungary held a 6-1 edge after the seventh round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina yesterday. Szabo played a drawn game with Ludek Pachman of Czechoslovakia in a King's Indian defense of twenty-five moves.

headline.main: SZABO HOLDS LEAD IN CHESS TOURNEY; Plays Draw With Pachman --Ivkov Also Deadlocked in Event at Argentina

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, March 19-- Juan Miranda of Argentina upset the mighty Wes Santee with a fierce stretch run in the 1.500meter event today. But the United States finished the track and field phase of the PanAmerican Games in a blaze of glory.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, March 19-- Juan Miranda of Argentina upset the mighty Wes Santee with a fierce stretch run in the 1.500meter event today. But the United States finished the track and field phase of the PanAmerican Games in a blaze of glory.
docs.abstract: J Miranda (Argentina) defeats W Santee (US) in 1,500-meter run; US wins 20th track champ

headline.main: MIRANDA DEFEATS SANTEE IN UPSET FOR 1,500 CROWN; Argentine Nips American as Both Post 3:53.2 Time, a Pan-American Record. DECATHLON TO JOHNSON 3 Relay Teams Win to Give U. S. 20 Firsts in Track-- Flores Takes Marathon MIRANDA DEFEATS SANTEE IN 1,500

docs.snippet: Week Ended March 18, 1955 It was a dull week in the foreign exchanges. Lacking the nervous movement of the two major units--British sterling and the Canadian dollar--as this revolved around Bank rate changes, only a fair business was reported with no...
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended March 18, 1955 It was a dull week in the foreign exchanges. Lacking the nervous movement of the two major units--British sterling and the Canadian dollar--as this revolved around Bank rate changes, only a fair business was reported with no significant price variations.
